meanings.definition: To preserve (blood, embryos, or tissues) by freezing at very low temperatures.
meanings.sent1: Scientists cryopreserve cells to keep them alive for future use.
meanings.sent2: It is important to cryopreserve organs for transplantation to save lives.
meanings.sent3: The cryopreserved blood was so cold, it felt like it came from an ice dragon!
meanings.sent4: Her memories were cryopreserved in her mind, frozen in time like a photograph.
meanings.sent5: The cryopreservation process is like pressing pause on the life of the cells.

meanings.definition: The process of preserving something by freezing it at very low temperatures.
meanings.sent1: Cryopreservation is used in medicine to store tissues for future use.
meanings.sent2: The cryopreserve of seeds ensures they will remain viable for years.
meanings.sent3: The cryopreservation of the ice cream kept it from melting in the hot sun.
meanings.sent4: In the story, the cryopreserve of the ancient artifact preserved its beauty for centuries.
meanings.sent5: The cryopreservation of the flowers made them look like delicate ice sculptures.
